Moved to this neighborhood ten years ago and was so happy to have a local family owned pizza shop and restaurant so close to home. After ten years still the best.

Been enjoying Nello's for over 30 years now and am still their biggest fan! Food-delicious. Ambience-fantastic. People-absolute best. I have eaten all over the world and am still impressed every time I come in. New dish for me-Margarita Pizza with sausage. Excellent.

If you desire true Chicago deep dish pizza, then Nello's should be at the top of your list! This is a staple pizza location in the Valley- and my family has been going for years. Nello's offers a great menu, drink list, and atmosphere. They offer an excellent Mon-Fri lunch special - a large drink, salad and 2-topping personal pizza for $8.99- what a steal! Don't pass this place up, it's worth it.

We ate at Nello's last night and it was bomb! We had the Old World salad with house dressing and the pesto Bianca pizza with sausage. BEST part about the whole thing was our server- Joshua. Ask for him!!! He was on it all night, great recommendations- there exactly when we needed him, told us to get the smaller salad (and we were so glad!) and was just super helpful and chill. He even put an extra container of house dressing in our to-go box when we hadn't asked. Just above and beyond. We sat there talking about how he was the best server we'd had in a long time!

PIZZA HEAVEN

My favorite is to get a pepperoni and sausage.  They make their sausage there, and it's delicately seasoned.  The sauce has a good amount of garlic in it, and herbs, and it is wonderful beyond words.  Best deep dish pizza I've ever had.
The house italian dressing is so good I'm tempted to drink it. I get a salad every time because of it. I drizzle it on my pizza too.... I have a problem...

NOT A FAN, they claim this is a Chicago type Pizza (NO) is my response.  The atmosphere is pretty friendly - great neighborhood pizza joint.  Wait staff very friendly, but the Pizza (hand tossed or their original crust) not so good, the sauce was tasteless not very italian (bland) to be exact, the sausage was very overdone or dry.

Might go back definitely won't get their pizza may try a italian sandwich???? We'll see
I'll let you know !!

Ate here many, many months ago.  A favorite pizza place for Mom and me!!  She absolutely ADORES the spinach pie, while I enjoy it and many other varieties, including the Margherita and Alaskan (white sauce, seafood).  I really appreciate the fact that whole-wheat pizza crusts are available!  Wish more establishments would offer alternative options, such as whole-wheat and gluten-free for those w/ food allergies and issues...

If thin-crust pizzas rock your boat, like they do mine, then check out Nello's!

I have been a customer of Nellos Mesa for a long time now and am always happy with the food, the environment, and of course the Owner Brian and the rest of the awesome Nello's employees :-)) But I do have to say I have always been a plain thin crust margarita pizza fan until I had the Deluxe Combo original crust pizza tonight.... AMAZING!!! So delicious and made with perfection!!!

We love this place. They are the real deal. Service is always great & it's never too busy. As for the food I know you want to know about the pizza. The crust is perfect the perfect ratio of crunch & chew. My favorite is the Mt. Veggie, which is saying something as I'm typically not a veggie pizza person. Any other time I'm a pepperoni & jalapeño (or olive) kinda girl, maybe Hawaiian. There's just something about the little caverns of cheese the veggies make, meanwhile the veggies come out hearty & flavor truly worthy of being on a pizza. However, the real treat here is something totally unexpected for a pizza joint, the salads. The secret is the house dressing which, honestly, if it wasn't frowned upon, I might just drink. It's that good. You can even get this sun dried tomato spiked treat by the bottle to take home.

If you are s pizza fan, I must tell you that Nellos is the best pizza in the valley by far! Love it so much we order enough for leftovers everytime we go! If you want great pizza, great service And a clean place to eat, try Nellos!

I undersold this place in my earlier review. It's the best. Period. I've received the same quality food every visit. The same staff is always friendly and smiling. They even throw an old paratrooper a military discount (played a hunch they're proudly displaying our flag in the entrance). And please tip and respect your server! *that wonderful meatball sub you're about to eat may have been made by a veteran chopper punk* grab a slice and I highly recommend the meatball sandwich. It rocks!
Food and service at Nellos is pretty good. Portions are a good size and the bread they give you to start the meal is delish!
Best pizza I have ever tried! The crust is super delicious. And their wings are on point, not too dry not to juicy. Def will be ordering take out from here!

Since I've moved to AZ in the 90s my family has become familiar with Nello's in Scottsdale. Recently they have closed that Scottsdale location and the Tempe one we also visited. I've been to this Mesa location a few times and I LOVE IT. Most recently we ordered a pitcher of Miller Lite and for some reason, it was the best Miller Lite draft I've ever had in a restaurant! The pizza has always been great and Mesa's cannot be beat. Nice neighborhood-like atmosphere, yet the parking lot is small and run down. Not much you can do about it though. I'm really hoping Nello's stays open in Mesa for a very long time. MUST TRY!

So this is probably the best pizza I've ever had!!! We ordered the Skinny and the BBQ Chicken, so freaking good.  Although, idk that I would call it Chicago style, having had Giordano's, but it's definitely good.  Looking to go back!

Personally not my style. People recommended this place to me, so went on a whim. Service was subpar, food was subpar, just not a good showing at all. I wouldn't go back. No one in my family enjoyed it, but a lot of our friends rave about it and love it. Maybe its a personal choice but not where I would go.

Maybe I just don't get it, but I really don't think this is the greatest pizza in the world. Not even top 5. It's good stuff and I support local businesses so I'd visit again, but it's not my top choice.

Nello's Pizza is like home, the food is amazing and homemade. My favorite pizza for 30 years hands down.You can really tell how much effort goes into the tiniest details and how much they care. My favorites include the Deluxe Combo pizza, the Old World Classic Salad with the house dressing, and the eggplant bruschetta ..it still shocks me how generous they are with the toppings. Everything is like that..huge portions and super friendly service at a reasonable price..no wonder they are so busy!! Over the top.

Everything on the menu is amazing. It's hard to choose just one pizza so we usually order 2 or 3 small ones and all share! The service is fantastic and we always leave more than satisfied. Highly recommended

Last night our family went to Nello's for a graduation ceremony celebration. I had not been to Nello's in over 20 years, but it was just as fantastic as I remember. Not only was the pizza fantastic so was the customer service. We had a group of seven and the server was friendly, served us quickly and with ease and made us feel right at home. Not one person in our party wasn't blown over by the pizza and only two of us had a previous experience with Nello's. It was a great night and going to Nello's made it even better.

This is the best Chicago style pizza in Phoenix! My family has been going to Nello's for the past 30 years! The original style crust is wonderfully golden and crisp! Our favorite pizza is pepperoni and sausage! The sausage is delicious and made every day! Our favorite salad is the Old World Classic with the delicious House Dressing! The dressing is a spicy Italian style, but it is so good I buy some bottles to go. It's also great for dipping the pizza in! 

The place is the BEST! You won't be disappointed!
This is my go to pizza place. They may cost a little more than your commercial joint, but the flavor makes up for it. Great sauce and crust they have won a customer for life in my eyes.

Whenever we come out to Arizona to visit friends, my wife and I make it a point to visit Nello's at least once while we're out there. Why? Because it's darn good, that's why! 

Nello's signature style pizza is this neat little hybrid of a pan and a thin crust. It's thin and crispy through and through, yet still has enough density to hold its own when the toppings start piling on. Yeah, it's a little different, but that's why it's so special. My suggestion is to get the Pizza Bianca, something about it and it's sauce-less, garlic-y, cheesiness just makes my happy.

Let's not forget about their house dressing either. If I could somehow get it to survive with me on the 6+ hour drive back home with me to California, I would bring it home by the case. It's hard to describe, but it compliments a house salad oh so beautifully.

So, why only four stars?! Well, I've listed everything about Nello's that is worth mentioning. Everything else on the menu is sort of ho-hum. The wings and other sides lack texture and, more importantly, flavor. Stick to the pizza, salad, and of course, the beer on tap.

I thought the thin crust pizza was pretty good, but not the best I've had. My husband ordered a deep dish and it was awful.  All bread and practically no toppings.  They are also pretty expensive.  I would not go back.

Great pizza even better service! Andrew Clarke and Michael Hitzel always take amazing care of us when we come in to eat and the kitchen and floor managers Rio and Jimmy always make sure our service and food are exceptional!

OMG. Love Nello's. I have not been there in YEARS so went a few weeks ago and WOW. I like lots of cheese and you get it at Nello's. The sausage pizza was great and I hear they make it themselves. Cheap wine and beer as well. The place was crazy crowded...and we still got a seat right away. Great waiter and very friendly. Great local place and no wonder they have been open for so many years! :)

Overall this place wasn't bad.. We ordered garlic bread, hot wings and pizza. Their garlic bread was just ordinary nothing special about it and pizza was okay.. My boyfriend who has been here before said their pizza was a little off than usual.. Their wings was good though not your Long Wong wings but I probably enjoyed the wings more than the pizza.. I don't know if they just had an off day or what.. But it seemed like they had a lot of regulars, the waitress seemed to know few customers by their name..
The pizza here has been top notch and full of flavor ..I've never been disappointed here even when it's crowded ..the service has been great as well ..the salads are really good as well ..

Nellos Pizza Mesa is the best! Their portions are huge, all the ingredients are made fresh daily including the delicious crust, and the staff is always very friendly! A few of my favorites include the triple baked Garlic Parmesan wings, the Asian Chicken Salad, original crust Skinny pizza (loaded with meat) , and of course the cookie pie!! They also have a very delicious House dressing, I highly recommend, we take a bottle home for our salads and we even marinate our chicken in it, it's amazing!! I saw a few reviews on here complaining about the prices but I thought their prices were more than fair considering the portion sizes and amount of toppings. The food also comes out in a very timely manner and the atmosphere makes you feel right at home! If you are looking for a family-friendly, scratch kitchen style of food, with reasonable prices this is the place to go!!

I don't get it.  To be fair, I've only had their pizza, while eatable, I would never go back. Its definitely a huge jump up from the Domino's & Pizza Huts but not even close to a Spinato's Pizza (my favorite) or a Casanova Brothers Pizza, as far as chains go, I think NYPD is much better than this.  I know I'm in the minority here & I love pizza but just not Nello's.

The pizza was good but nothing special. It took over 40 minuets to get our pizza. The servers were friendly though. Overall, if your not willing to wait a while for pizza that isn't something special, I wouldn't recommend it. But if your in the area and you don't mind the wait, then definently check it out.
One of the best pizzas in the valley. Especially if you are looking for a thin crust pizza.  The half baked cookie Sunday is also to die for.

This is the first pizza place where I haven't eaten the pizza. My visits usually consist of the spring salad with their made-in-house dressing and either a sandwich or pasta. Every sandwich is excellent and filling no matter which you choose.

The atmosphere is excellent with sports on in the backround and this Nello's location has the friendliest wait staff out of all of them.

Dear Nello's, 

I love you. You may think I am moving too fast as I just met you last week, but I have never been so sure of my emotions. Every bite filled me with happiness. Each slice of your pizza was a flavorful perfection. I love how you give me the choice of getting a wheat crust. There are so many flavors I want to try. The spinach pie will always remind me of our first encounter though. Your pizzas are affordable and amazing. One of the best I have ever had in my life. You beat pizza in Italy. Sorry Italy.

I've been eating Nello's since my childhood and I get hungry every time i think about eating there. Recently bought a house in the area and we joke that we did it just so we were around the corner from the restaurant. I love the salad, house dressing, sandwiches and original crust pizza. You seriously can't go wrong with anything on the menu and the service is always great.

Top notch pizza!! Need good pizza and beer, stop here. Stopped by on a recommendation of a friend, on national pizza day. Surprise got seated right away. Atmosphere is kinda barish but not overly. I like they have several craft local beers!! Had Italian bread as an appetizer came with an olive oil dip, very good. Went with a thin skinny, which is loaded with meat and strips server recommend extra crispy for doneness and he made the perfect call!. Will be a good go to for here on. You need this pizza in your life!!

Nello's is great, I've eaten pizza from all over the country and can honestly say this is great pizza. We usually go there for Pizza every sunday afternoon. They claim Chicago style, the thick wheat crust emulates that. The quality of ingredients are amazing, I usually order a Chicken-Bacon-Pepperoni combo, which is always awesome. My wife always gets their Turkey-Avocado sub with extra house dressing. The house dressing is amazing and worth pouring all over a sandwich or salad.

Every one of there locations has a nice midwestern pizzeria feel, growing up outside Detroit, one thing I miss is an old-school pizzeria. The bonus is that they carry local brew from Four Peaks on tap and always stay seasonal, and for a "beer snob" like me that's worth giving 5-stars!

Friendly servers, accommodating cooks, clean and nice atmosphere, delicious food makes this a must visit restaurant. The pizza is made extremely well and tastes fresh. The lasagna is meaty, cheesy and delicious. The cookie with ice cream dessert is tasty as it's not hard but not too gooey.

Nello's Pizza is fab. Just mother-loving fabulous. My mom and I came here on a whim on a weekend night because we suddenly were hungry for pizza. The wait was not bad as expected. We split a small [biiiiig small] salad and a small thin-crust pizza with enough leftovers of both for my brother. Our server was super nice, but kind of spacy. I don't want to deduct anything from my review about him - maybe he had too many tables or was new, I'm not sure. Our salad came out quite quickly, but then it took forever for the pizza, so it was hard to maintain self-control over the salad while waiting. Hands down some of the best food I've had during my Valley visits over the years!

Reminiscent of Midwest pizza. Liking both the thin and thick crust and the Italian Beef sandwich is very nice! I also am a fan of the Kiltlifter beer they have on tap. Comfortable place to meet friends and have a couple brewskis!
Best pizza ever... Not an expensive price either. Get the original deep crust!!! Great service too.

This must be a fairly good time if you're a regular. There is a substantial crowd that's obviously having a ball, very friendly. But for an occasional customer we have twice now been completely unimpressed with the service. Once we were seated after a regular couple who came in behind us and tonight felt fairly ignored at a party. Two thin crust pizzas were both cooked well with nice crust but little flavor. They do have a good local beer selection and a good salad (Strawberry and walnut). But the service is remarkably terrible. We had to ask for water and twice to get more napkins. It took a good 15  min to bring uninspired wings and the salad and both were long gone another 15 min or more before the pizza arrived. That was 10 min after Zack told us two min. which was only after we flagged him down to enquire about the delay. Having watched two tables of regulars get there's before us the question begged asking.  Afterall, we had been seated well before them both.  For an explaination we were told that thin crust just takes longer. Upon request, Zack took away some of the dirty dishes. OK. Whatever.

I've always liked Nellos. My boyfriend loves it so it's always been one of those places we go to regularly. The service is always good. My favorite is their BBQ chicken pizza and the skinny. I occasionally treat myself to an Italian soda as well which are also really tasty. Just recently I went there after one of my art shows with a group of people. I called ahead to let them know we were coming and when we got there the table was set up and ready to go. The service was good, we made it easy by ordering pitchers of beer and a few large pizzas. The server did a great job by getting the dirty plates off our table when we were finished. We wanted to sit and drink more, and I personally can't stand it when dirty plates just sit there. We ended up ordering a few more pitchers and staying longer. All in all it was a pleasant evening. I'll be suggesting this place for it's great pizza, good service, and It's good accommodations for bigger parties.
Great place, pizza and environment! I was surprised that I walked into a pizza place and waited to be seated. But it was worth the wait!

Came in on a busy day, and thought to sit at the 2 Tables between the bar and the order pick up window... 

I did not realize this means no service area, as all waiters n even the hostess didnt look at us, or ask us if we could be helped,,, Maybe they assumed we were waiting for a pickup order... 

Well thats about 60 buck that walked out the door.. Hope that gets communicated so someone is responsible for those 2 tables.. I went for lunch one day with my friend and we had to kind of be rude to get service there,, thought it would be addressed after that, but i guess not...

Okay let me start off by saying that Nellos has THE BOMB pizza. I mean, explosively good pizza. It changed my life. I started giving back to the community, I read the bible more, heck, I even help elderly people put stuff in their cars! But a dark time came when I ordered something other than the pizza....the lasagna. I would tell people far and wide how amazing the pizza was, and lo and behold I was let down by the lasagna. I'm a fraud now. It was some sort of weird microwave creation that had veggies that don't belong in a saucy Italian delicacy and my trust was broken. Unless you have found your life changing meal at Nellos, I suggest you stick to the pizza...

I came in with my girlfriend on a Friday night.  I would say there were about 60% tables filled.  We arrived at 8:41pm and sat at our table for about 15 minutes without anyone coming to take our drink order.  Now in this 15 minutes we witnessed 2 waiters working their asses off and 6 staff members standing around at the bar.  One bar tender that was speaking with a waitress and literally didn't take a break from their conversation for that whole time.  3 team members were folding silverware this whole time.  Now I love having silverware but this delegation of team member efforts was a little on the silly side.  We finally had to go see the hostess to get any type of service.  When this person came to our table all we got was a "sorry they switched our tables and didn't tell anyone". I hate to leave two stars cause I love the food here but honestly this may be the last time we visit this establishment.

I finally made it to Nello's and am so happy I did.  Laura A. called and said she was craving pizza and since I'm the pizza addict anytime this rare occasion happens I am down in a heartbeat to go.  So since she lives in Mesa we decided to check out Nello's as the reviews were all top notch.  

Upon arrival we were greated and we said we were ordering a to go order so we were shown the to go window.  Brian greeted us there after giving us a brief minute to scope out the wonderful menu.  We decided to get two 10" pies to get a good trial run at this place.  He was very nice and gave us some ideas and we went with The Murphy which has strips of bacon and onions on it and I got a custom pie with sun dried tomato's, gouda cheese, and green peppers.  

When we got home we devoured both pies the sauce was great and we had one deep dish and one thin crust.  I preferred the deep dish but they both were great.  

I will for sure be back for more pizza and to try their sandwich's as they sounded very good as well.  The service was great everyone was very nice it felt like a great neighborhood restaurant.  I think that feeling at a lot of restaurants has been lost today so it was very nice.  

4.5/5

went back and hung out at the bar and enjoyed some craft beer while waiting for pizzas we ordered to take home. I absolutely love Nellos even more than my first encounter. The people here are super friendly and there are a lot of regulars. They just make you feel so welcome. Tried the eggplant brochette while we waited for our custom ordered pizzas and the brushetta is ummm how can i explain it..great? Marvelous, splendid? Superfreakingdelish? yup superfreakingdelish works..

I ordered take out and it was very good.  Ready when they said it would be.  Staff was friendly, and the pizza was great!  I would certainly go back!  It was a Friday night, so it was pretty busy, but I was helped right away.

As always, Nello's is consistent. Went here and ordered from here on many occasions. The more you come in the better the service gets, only had one kind of terrible experience and the manager made up for it. All the ingredients taste fresh - extra toppings, you get what you pay for - hard to say that about anyone else that is close. 

Bartender's and server's are friendly and speedy. Don't wait if something is incorrect, they are usually 'moving' and you might not get one right away.

I have been going to this place since I was a kid. This is hands down the best deep dish pizza in the valley!

If you like bbq chicken pizza, Nellos has the best there is! Even though the bbq is excellent, the rest of their food is excellent as well.

We have been going to Nellos for years. Last night the hubby and I went for date night.  We started off with the Eggplant "brushetta" .  The toppings were heavy and the bread soggy. While tasty it was definitely NOT brushetta worthy.  Rename it to Eggplant Cheesy Bread and then you will get what you expect.  We also ordered the Spring salad with the house Balsamic. It was delicious!!  Nellos makes the best house dressing and this was equally as yummy as the original. We each order our own pizza. Hubby loved his pan crust Skinny. I being a creature of habit ordered what I ALWAYS get, the thin crust wheat spinach pie.  Here is why I only gave three stars... I think they must have a new chef. The pizza was soggy and I had to get a magnify glass out to find any feta... Oh no!! The main ingredient I was craving!  :( I voiced my complaint to our very attentive and friendly waiter Zach.  He had them make another. I requested it To Go  as by then hubby had finished his meal. Unfortunately the second pizza was the same as the first.  I will probably go back because the salads are just so wonderful but unfortunately my favorite pizza is no longer an option I will take a risk on again.  So disappointed after craving it all day!
Really expensive and not very good my pizza was really under cooked and I got really sick from it. Im sorry nellos I will not be back

My wife and I was looking for somewhere to eat dinner when I mentioned we had not been to nello's in several years.  We decided to give it a make it our place for dinner.  We arrived just in time because our wait was only 15 min and shortly after we were seated the wait time jumped to 40 min.  We go our drinks and ordered promptly.  I had the eggplant parmigan and my wife had the old world salad.  Now I have to mention we both had the half orders and still brought food home.  The eggplant parmigan and the salad were both excellent.  The sauce was not to acidly and the pasta was cooked just right.  We had forgotten about this little gem and will try to make it for dinner more often?

My husband and I have eaten here several times, and absolutely love it! We've always had good service and great food. Tonight was a different story and very disappointing. My husband ordered two small pizzas, a pizza crust, and a large antipasto salad. They said it would be a 15-20 minute wait for carry out but he waited over 45 minutes. Also I understand with the increase in minimum wage that businesses have had to increase their prices but your increases are steep. Especially since the quality isn't what it used to be either. Sadly I think tonight was our final meal here. So sad to see something that used to be so wonderful and so delicious turn into what it has!

When ever i get to go here i am always happy with the food and service,
Never have i had a bad time here.
The small deep dish pizzas are amazing.
Nothing wrong with this place.

Maybe it was just because I was really hungry, but this pizza really hit the spot and tasted like the best pizza ever.  We ordered a medium pepperoni with extra cheese and it was absolutely delicious in my opinion.  The sauce was very flavorful and not sweet at all, which I like.  It tasted more like garlic/oregano/herbs/etc. Very fresh.  The toppings were sliding off there was so much cheese, which again, I liked.  The crust was also good.  Perfect happy medium between deep dish and thin crust.  Service was top notch.  They checked back with us several times, pizza got to our table soon after ordering, and when we left I think we had about 36 employees tell us to have a nice evening.

LOVE Nello's. We've been here about a zillion times, not sure how I haven't reviewed it yet. Love the thin-crust pizza, and their salads are awesome. Consistently great service. Place is always packed and has a ton of regulars - a good sign of a good joint. I've also had the deep dish pizza and it's great too. Also have tried a few pasta dishes, and have never been disappointed. Can get pretty noisy on a busy Friday night, as the acoustics aren't great and if you mix in a few screaming rug rats, it can get loud. But I consider it part of the ambience of a family-type joint. Highly recommended!

If you want good pizza, go to Nello's. That's it, bottom line. I'm partial to the thin crust pizzas, especially the buffalo one! My fiancé loves the Skinny aka meats galore. We always order for pick up, and they are always accurate on their timing which is never extremely long. I don't think you can be disappointed with anything you get here.

The pizza was really good. It has really good flavor. The only disappointment was the wings. I thought they would be more crispy but they weren't crispy at all and the flavor wasn't very good. But I'll definitely be back for pizza.
Excellent pizza family friendly environment we really enjoyed our time here how salad is excellent as well

"You better cut the pizza in four pieces because I'm not hungry enough to eat six."  ? Yogi Berra

Nothing beats a cheesy deep-dish pizza with all your beloved toppings.  That original pan crust is crazy delicious.  It's always busy here for a reason.  I personally love the BBQ Chicken.  If you grab it to go, make sure you toss some fresh cilantro on top for even more flavor.  Their wings are also incredible and they even throw some Parmesan on top of the Garlic Parmesan Wings for more cheesy-goodness.  Nello's pies are flavorful and packed full of calories so if you're on a diet, leave it outside and indulge.  This 30+ year-old award-winning establishment is made of love.

I think of dieting for the new year and then I eat Nello's pizza.  No shame.  No regrets.

The Original Nello's -- Established 1983 -- has been serving by far the best pizza. And it's not just the pizza, it's the whole menu. Salads with famous house dressing, Italian spaghetti and pasta, garlic bread with Italian "Margarita" pizza topping, sandwiches, oven baked barbecue chicken wings, and a selection of wine and craft beer.

Jack Salley
Mesa, AZ

I want to be able to give Nello's 3.5 stars. 

Great:
I love the attentive service, the REALLY great beer selection (wine too) and portion sizes. Family run joint, that you have to stop into if you live in The Valley. You just do.

Meh:
I can't say I am overwhelmed by the food, it's standard fair - Done right. But I am fairly underwhelmed.

Overall:
The restaurant is cozy and has that "easy going" family atmosphere. I do appreciate Nello's for staying in business all these years. It has a great nostalgia for a lot of us on the East Side.

I will upgrade their thin crust pizza to well above serviceable.  Thick crust still isn't my thing.  I really like the house salad dressing.

BTW...I only go here because my family likes it.  I can take or leave.
I wanted a  bite size portion of cheese and mushrooms  with cheesy goodness.  Didn't happen
